New Records: Willy Adames tied the major-league record for three-run home runs in a season with his 13th such homer
Key Match Events: Brewers' three home runs were a grand slam, a three-run homer, and a two-run shot, producing all nine of their runs
Pedro Pages had the first two-homer game of his career
Brendan Donovan singled, went to third on a double by Paul Goldschmidt and scored on a sacrifice fly by pinch-hitter Luken Baker
Andre Pallante gave up a three-run homer to Willy Adames and a two-run homer to Rhys Hoskins
Jackson Chourio hit a grand slam off Riley O'Brien
Post-Match Reflections: The Cardinals fell to 3-8 against the Brewers, including a 1-4 record in Milwaukee
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers increased their lead over the Cardinals to 12 games
The Brewers have outscored the Cardinals 677-575 and have a run differential of plus 139, while the Cardinals' run differential is minus 58
Others: Paul Goldschmidt extended his streak with at least one double to five consecutive games
Brendan Donovan had been 0-of-14 against Freddy Peralta before he singled in the fourth and sixth
The Cardinals' Steven Matz will start the second game of the series on Tuesday night after being activated off the injured list on Sunday
